name: (2,2-dibromoethenyl)benzene
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-4246
Reason: 1,2-propanediol base melting point is around 50 degrees Celsius. The introduction of two additional phenyl groups and a bromine atom increases the melting point due to the enhancement of the crystalline structure and the increase in molecular weight. Each phenyl group may contribute around +30 to +50°C. The bromine atom introduces a significant increase due to the formation of a rigid structure and the presence of a halogen, which can participate in hydrogen bonding and dipole interactions, raising the melting point by approximately +20°C.
